title: Matinee Mondays and online ticketing
body: Two words: MATINEE MONDAY! Amazing. Before tonight, our biggest Monday was last week with 50 people... total. We more than doubled that tonight. Was it just because of MATINEE MONDAY? I doubt it, but I bet that was a big part of it. Most people were just here to catch LADIES IN LAVENDER or THE ARISTOCRATS before they left town. I bet we almost sell out THE ARISTOCRATS tomorrow night. It's going to be crazy. On that note, if you want to buy your tickets up to a week in advance, give this a shot: http://tickets.moxiecinema.com. Here's how it works: (1) go to the online ticketing gateway, (2) click on the movie time you want to purchase, (3) laugh at the hideous payment gateway (note: I didn't build it!), (4) pay for your tickets with your credit card of choice, (5) print out your receipt, (6) bring your credit card with you to the theater, (7) pick up your tickets. It's just that easy. Once you buy your tickets online, they're yours... reserved... set in stone... too legit to quit. Isn't that cool? Ok, I have to go clean now. PS - MATINEE MONDAYS are running for the entire month of November... and if they're all as successful as tonight, they may just run forever.
author: Dan

comments.author: Jordan
comments.body:
I had my first ever Moxie experience this past Monday at "The Aristocrats", and it was a knee-slapping good time.

Granted, I'm not one to indulge in knee-slapping in a public place, but if I were... I guarantee some knee-slapping would've occurred.  No question about it.

From the look of it, you guys have got some worthwhile stuff in the pipeline, so I plan to return fairly regularly.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Oh definitely Rufus.  He has a song on the mix CD that came with Nick Hornby's songbook that is just flat out amaaaaazing.

Darius Rucker has said many times, with a little annoyance, that no member of the band was either Hootie OR the Blowfish.  The name comes from the nicknames of 2 inseparable buddies the band knew in college that had nothing to do with the band itself.  Hootie had big owl like glasses and The Blowfish was kinda chubby.

Ahem.  I have never listened to Hootie and The Blowfish or anything.
